body:
> Although this may be a default chalk prefers, it pollutes blue for others who consume this module (depending on the NPM topology).

Why is this a problem? It's done for a very good reason, as `blue` on Windows CMD is completely illegible and I've gotten so many issues about using `blue` on various repos the past year.

> It might be a better idea if chalk merely wrapped ansi color, and delegated blue to brightblue

How is that different from how it works now?
Because it is overriding code from the ansi-color module, if that module happens to be de-dupped, this polution will affect other libraries consuming It.
Basically cloning ansi-color definition before modifying it: https://github.com/sindresorhus/chalk/blob/master/index.js#L16

I didn't think of that scenario. I guess we're going to see a LOT of similar problems when npm@3 comes out. In hindsight exporting `ansi-styles` as an object was not the best idea...

Changing `ansi-styles` to export a function that returns a fresh object might be better, as others might also fall into this trap.

> Changing `ansi-styles` to export a function that returns a fresh object

:+1: Sounds good to me.

Yes. Although ansi-color providing a fresh clone seems unrelated. Mutating foreign modules should be considered poor practice. Relying on a foreign module to clone itself seems error prone, unless it becomes a tested and official part of the public api.

repository.name: ansi-styles
repository.description: ANSI escape codes for styling strings in the terminal

issue.title: Changed markdown-color blue to bright-blue to be the same on all platforms
issue.body:
Chalk changes [blue to bright blue when on windows](https://github.com/sindresorhus/chalk/blob/master/index.js#L15-L17), causing the utilities/markdown-color unit tests to fail on windows.

This PR sets chalk's blue to bright blue for all platforms, fixing the tests for the time being [until it can be fixed upstream](https://github.com/sindresorhus/chalk/issues/63).

body:
Awaits discussion in https://github.com/chalk/ansi-styles/pull/10

After that: bump the `ansi-styles` version and switch to `.create`.

issue.title: [Snyk] Upgrade chalk from 1.0.0 to 1.1.3
issue.body:
Snyk have raised this PR to upgrade `chalk` from 1.0.0 to 1.1.3. - The recommended version is **4 versions** ahead of your current version. - The recommended version was released **3 years ago**, on 2016-03-29.
Release notes
  • 1.1.3 - 2016-03-29

    v1.1.3

  • 1.1.2 - 2016-03-28

    v1.1.2

  • 1.1.1 - 2015-08-19

    Fixes a very strange issue with using the same name for a variable and its assigned function. #81

    Probably a V8 bug.

  • 1.1.0 - 2015-07-01

    Introducing chalk 1.1.0!

    Chalk is now used by over 4000 npm packages and has become the eight most depended on package in the world!

    Update

    $ npm install --save chalk

    Highlights

    • Chalk has moved to its own org! github.com/chalk/chalk.
    • gray.dim is a noop on Windows to work around cmd.exe bugs. #58
    • chalk/ansi-styles now exposes an unique object per required instance. #63 Thanks to Qix-!
    • chalk/chalk-cli wraps chalk for easy use on the command-line.
    • 100% code coverage.

    Changes

    v1.0.0...v1.1.0

    Contribute

    Help us get npm packages upgraded to chalk 1.1.0 by submitting a Pull Request to any of these repositories upgrading their chalk dependency in package.json.

    We're also looking for feedback on the documentation. If you think anything can be improved, let us know by opening an issue ;)

    Made with by Sindre, Joshua, JD, and all our wonderful contributors.

  • 1.0.0 - 2015-02-23

    Introducing chalk 1.0.0!

    Chalk is a node module for styling/colorizing terminal output.

    Chalk is now used by ~3000 npm packages and even displayed on the npm landing page.

    Fun fact: Technically, color doesnt exist. Color is created only when our brain tries to make sense from light signals it receives from the outer world. In other words, its all in your head.

    Update

    $ npm install --save chalk

    Highlights

    • Style application order is now left-to-right as one would expect. Was previously the reverse. 0234fe9
    • Force the blue color to be bright blue on Windows as the normal blue is illegible. fc6a9b2
    • Ability to disable/enable colors on a per instance basis, rather than globally. 72d1c11
    • Add ability to force color by setting the FORCE_COLOR environment variable. 19935d6
    • Disable color when node is launched from Upstart. chalk/supports-color@3371f56

    Changes

    v0.5.1...v1.0.0

    Contribute

    Help us get npm packages upgraded to chalk 1.0.0 by submitting a Pull Request to any of these repositories upgrading their chalk dependency in package.json.

    We're also looking for feedback on the documentation. If you think anything can be improved, let us know by opening an issue ;)

    Made with by Sindre, Joshua, and all our wonderful contributors.

from [`chalk` GitHub Release Notes](https://github.com/chalk/chalk/releases)
